page.title: 01About Our Area
page.content: East Grinstead is a Sussex market town near the border of Kent and Surrey. The main part of the town was built on high land across the main London to Lewes Road,now the A22.Along the London Road there are shops,behind which there are houses and flats of all ages and sizes,both private and council properties. Industry is restricted to two main sites,one on Birches Industrial estate and the other on Durkins Farm.By far the largest proportion of the area is farmland and woodland.The area has been associated with the Sackville,Dorset and De La Warr families and this is reflected in the names of many of the buildings and roads.
